events.description: The S&P/NZX 50 fell 0.2% to close at 13,444 on Thursday, halting gains from the previous session.

events.event_name: Wall Street Tech and AI-linked Stock Pressure
events.description: Major US tech and AI-linked stocks came under pressure, influencing global investor sentiment.

facts.fact_text: The S&P/NZX 50 fell 0.2% to close at 13,444 on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P/NZX 50 fell 0.2% to close at 13,444 on Thursday
Non-energy minerals led the retreat, down 3.2%

facts.fact_text: The NZX 50 is 0.16% higher so far this week.

evidences.evidence_text: NZX 50 remains 0.16% higher so far this week

claims.claim_text: Pressure on US tech and AI-linked stocks dampened investor sentiment in New Zealand.

evidences.evidence_text: The decline followed Wall Street, where major US tech and AI-linked stocks came under pressure, dampening investor sentiment.

claims.claim_text: Markets are monitoring whether the weekly gains will persist through Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: with markets tracking if gains last until Friday.

links.source_ref: Wall Street tech and AI-linked stocks

evidence.evidence_text: The decline followed Wall Street, where major US tech and AI-linked stocks came under pressure, dampening investor sentiment.
Non-energy minerals led the retreat, down 3.2% with notable declines in Santana Minerals (-6.8%), Fletcher Building (-2.4%), Manuka Resources (-2.2%), and Chatham Rock Phosphate (-1.6%).
The S&P/NZX 50 fell 0.2% to close at 13,444 on Thursday, halting gains from the previous session
